title: How to Play Quidditch World Cup

steps.headline: Create two teams of at least 4 people per team.
steps.description: The more, the merrier and the longer the game will go for. Have them pair up in their team.

steps.headline: Draw or mark out two lines.
steps.description: These two lines should be at least three metres apart. One of these lines should be designated the "starting line".

steps.headline: Ask one pair per team to come forward and get ready to play.
steps.description: Have each pair face one another. One person should stand at one line and the other player opposite on the other line. Make sure that the opposing pairs have sufficient space between them to try to avoid collisions during play.

steps.headline: Hand each player behind the starting line a broom and a balloon each.
Start the quidditch!
steps.description: The aim of the game is for each starter person to sweep the balloon to his or her team-mate opposite. The team-mate then takes the balloon and sweeps it back to the start line. The first one back is the winner and the other pair is eliminated.

steps.headline: Continue playing until all pairs bar one from each team have been eliminated.
steps.description: The final two pairs represent one team each and the winner of this gets the Quidditch trophy.
